member.name: T:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility
member.summary: Defines utility methods related to unicode charactors handling.

member.name: M:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility.GetUnicodeBlockName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get unicode block name of specified UTF-32 code point.
member.returns: Unicode block name.

remarks.para: You can use unicode block name in class.
Unicode block name is defined in Unicode Standard. You can find all block name at http://www.unicode.org/Public/UNIDATA/UnicodeData.txt.

member.name: M:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility.GetLocalizedUnicodeBlockName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get localized unicode block name of specified UTF-32 code point with .
member.returns: Localized unicode block name.

remarks.para: You can use unicode block name in class.
Unicode block name is defined in Unicode Standard. You can find all block name at http://www.unicode.org/Public/UNIDATA/UnicodeData.txt.

member.name: M:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility.IsPrintable(System.Char)
member.summary: Determine that whether specified charactor is printable.
member.returns: true if is printable; otherwise, false.

remarks.para:
This method returns false to charactors which is always non-printable. Such charactors include:
Control charactor. Its category is (Cc).
Orphan surrogate char. Its category is (Cs).
Unassigned charactor. Its category is (On).
White space
Note that any modifiers and private used charactors are considered printable.
remarks.note: Line feed, page feed, cariage return, and horizontal/vertical tab charactors are also considered NON-printable.
remarks.para:
This method does not take into account presentation related issues. There serveral factors to prevent to 'print' charactor(s) in your display surface or external media including:
Required fonts are not installed. For example, 'Lucida Console' does not have any glyphs for Japanese charactors.
The program cannot have capability to change their fonts appropriately. For example, customized text control in some tools cannot display Japanese text due to lack of the capability.

member.name: M:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility.IsPrintable(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Determine that whether specified surrogate pair is printable.
member.returns: true if the codepoint represented by specified surrogate pair is printable; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:NLiblet.Text.UnicodeUtility.ShouldEscape(System.Char)
member.summary: Determine that whether specified charactor should be escaped.
member.returns: true if should be escaped; otherwise, false.

remarks.para:
This method returns true to charactors which should be escaped in trace/logging message. Such charactors include:
Control charactor. Its category is (Cc).
Orphan surrogate char. Its category is (Cs).
Unassigned charactor. Its category is (On).
Note that any modifiers and private used charactors should not be escaped.
remarks.note: Line feed, page feed, cariage return, and horizontal/vertical tab charactors should also be escaped.
remarks.para:
This method does not take into account presentation related issues. There serveral factors to prevent to 'print' charactor(s) in your display surface or external media including:
Required fonts are not installed. For example, 'Lucida Console' does not have any glyphs for Japanese charactors.
The program cannot have capability to change their fonts appropriately. For example, customized text control in some tools cannot display Japanese text due to lack of the capability.
White space. Note that there are several white space charactors other than ASCII white space (U+0020) like full-width white space (U+3000).

member.summary: Determines whether the specified same type other is equal to the instance.
member.returns: true if is equal to instance; otherwise, false.

item.description: ASCII; all non-ascii charcters will be escaped with \uxxxx syntax. Note that alphabet characeters in hexadecimal is always uppercase.

This indicator is only valid to , (considered as UTF-32).
Unicode block name.
Currently not supported.

This indicator is only valid to , (considered as UTF-32).
Unicode category

This indicator is only valid to , (considered as UTF-32).
Decimal representation of unicode codepoint.
Escaping non printable chars with U+FFFD.

Literal style. It is similar to 's' style, but additionaly escape '"' to '\"'.
String entity in collections will be always escaped using this style.
Multi line escaped char with \uxxxx notation. All control chars without line breaks, orphen surrogate, non-assinged code points will be escaped.
Raw-char without any escaping. It means that no escaping will not be performed.
Sulti line escaped char with \uxxxx notation. All control chars with line breaks, orphen surrogate, non-assinged code points will be escaped.

para.em: This indicator is only valid to , , (indicating it will be treated as UTF-32).

description.para: For integer, consider specified value as Utf-32 or UTF-16 style hexadecimal representation. You can specify additional format sepcifier following this like 'l', 'm', 's', 'u', 'x', etc. in this table to control format of UTF-32 value. For example, value '1' with format "uc" will be "Control", '0x61' with format "ub" will be "BasicLatin", and '0x1F0A1' with format "ur" will be spade ace mark.
For characters, this indicator specifies hexadecimal 0 padding like "0020" instead of case of 'x' like "20". The alphabets in hex representation will be uppercase.

para.em: This indicator is only valid to , , (indicating it will be treated as UTF-32).

description.para: For integer, consider specified value as Utf-32 or UTF-16 style hexadecimal representation. You can specify additional format sepcifier following this like 'l', 'm', 's', 'u', 'x', etc. in this table to control format of UTF-32 value. For example, value '1' with format "uc" will be "Control", '0x61' with format "ub" will be "BasicLatin", and '0x1F0A1' with format "ur" will be spade ace mark.
For characters, this indicator specifies hexadecimal 0 padding like "0020" instead of case of 'x' like "20". The alphabets in hex representation will be lowercase.

item.description:
This indicator is only valid to , , (considered as UTF-32).
Utf-16 hex, with alphabets in hex representation will be uppercase.

This indicator is only valid to , , (considered as UTF-32).
Utf-16 hex, with alphabets in hex representation will be uppercase.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: P:NLiblet.WeakReference`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object as strong reference.
member.value: Wrapped target value. This value may not be null.
member.exception: is false, thus target object has been already reclaimed by GC.
member.remarks: It is possible target object has been reclaimed since most recent call because of the nature of multi-threaded environment.

member.summary: Returns binary representation of specified hexadicimal format text.
member.param: Chars to be binary. This value can be null.
member.returns: Byte sequence of binary representation of specified ; or empty sequence when is null or empty.
member.exception: contains invalid charactor. Valid charactor is ASCII numbers or ACSII 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', or 'f' (cases are insensitive).
